timeline.body:
looks like the result of the following command won't be changed after multiple executions, so you can reuse it
```
sheetParser.getDataFromRange(range).stream().map(CellValue::getValue).collect(Collectors.toList())
```

timeline.body:
isn't is possible here and at 72 to use the following code?
79
```
return build(List.copyOf(exactData.keySet()), List.copyOf(exactData.values()), properties)
```
72
```
return build(List.of(column), ....., properties);
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
isn't is possible here and at 72 to use the following code?
79

return build(List.copyOf(exactData.keySet()), List.copyOf(exactData.values()), properties)

72

return build(List.of(column), ....., properties);

timeline.body: if you need to get data from cols with indexes like 1,5,6 they you will get row with index 1,2,3..... for each of those col indexes, so can we iterate through rows and populate cols without having to access the same rows multiple times?
